By May 1st, 2021, over 60% of the population had received at least one dose of the vaccine.

The chart shows the effective reproduction rate (R) of COVID-19 in Myanmar from April 2020 to April 2021. The reproduction rate is the average number of new infections caused by one infected individual during a specific time period. The data was obtained from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The reproduction rate ranges from 0.45 to 1.04, with an average of 0.67. The highest reproduction rate was recorded on April 28, 2020, at 1.04, while the lowest reproduction rate was recorded on April 22, 2020, at 0.45. The reproduction rate increased from April 2020 to April 2021, with a peak in May 2020. The data suggests that the effective reproduction rate in Myanmar has been consistently above 1 since the beginning of the pandemic, indicating a high level of community transmission."
